body.p: The IASB noted that the debate about risk components suffered from some common misunderstandings. In the IASB’s opinion, the root cause of those misunderstandings is the large number of markets and circumstances in which hedging takes place. This results in an inevitable lack of familiarity with many markets. In the light of the arguments raised and to address some of the misunderstandings, the IASB focused its discussions on non-contractually specified risk components of non-financial items and, in particular, on:

li.p: the effect of risk components; and
hedge ineffectiveness when designating a risk component.
